config

Class SolutionConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • config.SolutionConfig

  • public class SolutionConfig
extends java.lang.Object
     This class provides Configuration parameters for the adaptability and extensibility of the program.

 In production grade applications, this can be in property file. So it can be easily changed without recompiling the code.
 It also helps to deploy with Docker/Kubernets. But restriction of one file in Hackerrank didn't allow me to do that.
 So i have mentioned everything as a class parameters.

    • Field Detail

      • BYTES_TO_READ_AT_A_TIME

        public static final int BYTES_TO_READ_AT_A_TIME
         This parameter specifies number of bytes should be read during one IO Operation.
 This parameter has direct co-relation with time and JVM Heap Size.

 Setting this parameter to larger value will reduce program running time because we are reading more bytes for processing in One IO call.
 But It may create JVM Heap Size error as JVM will not be able to allocate such large byte array in a row.

 Setting this parameter to smaller value will increase program running time but saves us from OutOfHeapMemory error.

 This parameter should be set based on your current Heap size and input file size.
 For file size up to 10GB, i was able to run smoothly without JVM Tuning (tweaking any parameters of JVM Heap Memory).
 I used JProfiler to see. It had space for new Objects in JVM even with 10GB file. So my guess is it should work for very large size too.
 For File size in TBs, we may need to fine tune JVM.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FINAL_OUTPUT_FILE_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String FINAL_OUTPUT_FILE_NAME
         Final output file name will be actualName_output. If you want to change output to something else, replace it here.
 Do not replace output with empty string, it may create file with same name and replace original file
 with which we need to compare our ouput file for content check.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES

        public static final int NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES
         This parameter can be changed according to company's requirement.
 By Default it is set to 3.
 In Future if team scales to 10 employees and they want to give one file to each employee, then set the value to 10.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OUTPUT_FILE_SPLITTER

        public static final java.lang.String OUTPUT_FILE_SPLITTER
          output file name will be splitted in three parts. a actualFileName b. extraBytesSize c. fileNumber.
  Below splitter is used to split these three parts.
  If file name contains '_', you have to change this parameter with character that doesn't appear in filename.
        See Also:
